newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany-Korea air accord to up cargo capacity.
newsitem.headline: Germany-Korea air accord to up cargo capacity.

text.p: Cargo capacity between Germany and South Korea will be expanded substantially under a new air traffic agreement between Bonn and Seoul.
Scheduled services will be gradually increased from five to nine weekly for each country in 2000, the German transport ministry said.
Airlines will in future be able to fly to two destinations in the other country, a ministry statement said.
The agreement means Deutsche Lufthansa AG will be able to launch a daily flight to Seoul by 1998, the statement added.
Lufthansa and Korean Airlines(KAL) at present fly five times a week each between Frankfurt and Seoul and operate a six times a week joint freighter service.
German transport minister Matthias Wissman said in the statement that the additional capacity would meet expected market demand. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
